descriptionSet.description: The Indian 17th century emperor Shivaji experiences the appearence of Durga Ma. Both are ornamented with glittery elements added to the poster.

location.name: Delhi / The Priya Paul Collection of Popular Art
Delhi / The Priya Paul Collection of Popular Art

rights.text: Copyrighted. Copyright with the original artists and publishers.

hra:item.hra:value: description-en: The Indian 17th century emperor Shivaji experiences the appearence of Durga Ma. Both are ornamented with glittery elements added to the poster. (gs)

explanatory comments/crosstagging: This combination (of hero of resistance and blessings from a goddess) can be interpreted in several ways: perhaps the most common is to use Shivaji as anti-Muslim (because he resisted the Mughals), but this combination could also be seen simply as model to be emulated for activism and mobilization. (gs)
related literature: Braudel, Fernand 1981. "The Structures of Everyday Life". London: Collins. (gs)
related literature: de Certeau, Michel 1984. "The Practices of Everyday Life" . Berkeley: University of California Press. (gs)

related literature: Storey, John 1999. "Cultural Consumption and Everyday Life". New York: Oxford University Press. (gs)
